text: the relationship between China and the
UK hasn't always had been good a first
attempt to establish relations came in
1596 when three ships under the command
of captain wood sailed from England for
China with a letter from Queen Elizabeth
the first to the Emperor of China that
mission failed none of the crew ever
returned to give an account of the fate
of the rest Britain the China clash -
during the opium wars and the Chinese
still remember with horror the burning
of the old Summer Palace in 1816 more
recently Beijing resents were seized as
british interference on issues such as
human rights Taiwan Hong Kong and at
about Beijing give British Prime
Minister David Cameron the cold shoulder
after he met the Dalai Lama in 2012 the
things are changing the UK government
kept quiet about protests in Hong Kong
last year and now a recent visit to
China George Osborne was praised for not
bringing up human rights to the Chinese
government so why has this happened
quite simply the economy the last
Chinese leader to come to the UK on the
state visit with hooding how in 2005
since then China's economy has grown
massively now there is a Chinese middle
class who were high and British goods
and services it also has plenty of cash
to splash it has some 3.5 trillion US
dollars in foreign reserves and the UK
as China's favorite place to invest in
Europe putting some 30 billion u.s.
dollars over the past decade and
Britain's Chancellor of the Exchequer
George Osborne will want to secure
further investment from the Chinese he
has already told to the UK in China's
direction by joining the Asian
infrastructure investment bank the
equivalent to the World Bank but this
upset
Britain's main ally the United States
will be interesting to see though is how
much further the UK no China are going
to stick together
you
